LocaSwap is a single-page Android application developed by Ali Tagipour.

This project provides a simple and secure tool for location tracking, map display, and process control.

• Developer: Ali Tagipour
• Website: alitagipour.ir
• Language: Java
• IDE: Android Studio
• Open Source: Fully public / open-source. Anyone is free to use, review, or contribute.

Note: This is an educational demo. The developer holds no responsibility for misuse or data loss.

1. Open Source:
Licensed under the MIT license. Free to use, modify, and share.

2. No Liability:
The developer is not responsible for misuse, bugs, or data loss. Educational purposes only.

3. Legal Use:
Must comply with local and international laws. Misuse is prohibited.

4. Privacy:
No sensitive data is stored. Location is only displayed on-device. No server communication.

To test mock location in Developer Options:

1. Go to Settings → About Phone → Build Number and tap 7 times.
2. Open Settings → Developer Options.
3. Enable Allow Mock Locations.
4. Select LocaSwap as the Mock Location App.
5. Now test fake locations in the app.

Warning: For development and testing only. Not for production use.
